page.title: 09Water in Bourtie
page.content: Bourtie boasts a water reservoir at a height of 500 feet where the Pitgaveny ride meets Airyhillock. Water pumped in from the Rivers Ythan and Deveron is maintained by the Grampian Water Board and feeds townships as diverse as Oldmeldum and Insch, 15 miles away. ironically only five homesteads close to the reservoir receie Mains water supply from it. Some farms in the parish closer to Inverurie are provided with Inverurie mains supply. But the rest of the surrounding district has to provide its own water. Residents of Bourtie are therefore perhaps proud of their ability to be self-sustaining and self-reliant, when in years like 1976 and 1984 the summers were so dry that water was precious throughout Aberdeenshire. Bourtie resident are thrify and keep a water supply from their own wells.
